data.title: Enrolment
data.text:
Year 8 – 12 Enrolment

Please fill in the Enrolment Enquiry Form and submit it with the corresponding documentation to the General Office. The relevant Principal of Junior School or Senior School will then contact you regarding your child’s application.

Please note: At this stage, we can only accept enrolments in Years 8 – 12 from ‘in zone’ applicants and siblings, as we have reached our enrolment capacity for 2024. We apologise for any inconvenience that this may cause.

We can accept enrolment requests for out-of-zone students starting 2025.

Enrolment Enquiry Documentation

Enrolment Enquiry Form

Evidence for demonstrating permanent residential address

Evidence of student’s name and date of birth

Academic report for the previous semester

Year 7 Transition

Tours are conducted from February to May each year for prospective Year 7 students and their parents. Tours commence at 9.30am from the General Office and are approximately one hour in duration. Bookings are necessary, tour dates and the booking link are listed on the Home page.

The enrolment process begins in May when students submit their placement form to their primary school. Norwood also accepts Out of Zone placement requests at this time. In August placements are confirmed and students subsequently receive an enrolment pack.

Norwood Secondary College zone is available on findmyschool.vic.gov.au which hosts the most up-to-date information about Victorian school zones for 2022 onwards.

Students residing in this zone are guaranteed a place at our school, which is determined on the basis of your permanent residential address.

The Department provides guidance through the School Placement Policy to ensure that students have access to their designated neighbourhood school and the freedom to choose other schools, subject to capacity.

You can find more information and answers to frequently asked questions on the Department’s website under School zones.
